The lack of imposed structure and accountability may lead to procrastination or a lack of focus and discipline, resulting in incomplete or rushed learning experiences. Moreover, the absence of in-person guidance and mentorship can hinder student progress and limit their opportunities for personalized support.

Lastly, while online platforms may offer alternative methods of engagement, such as message boards or chat discussions, they often lack the spontaneity and richness of face-to-face interactions. Non-verbal cues, immediate back-and-forth exchanges, and the development of critical thinking skills through lively debates are compromised in online settings. These limitations can hinder the depth of understanding and the collaborative learning that occurs in traditional classrooms.
